titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Department of Animal and Plant Pathology, Princeton, NJ, Carl TenBroeck papers
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Department of Animal and Plant Pathology, Princeton, NJ, Carl TenBroeck papers FA968

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-10-29 00:23:58 -0400.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Department of Animal and Plant Pathology, Princeton, NJ, Carl TenBroeck papers

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research. Department of Plant Pathology

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Carl TenBroeck, 1885-1966, physician and researcher in animal pathology, Director of the Princeton laboratories of The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research 1930-1950, worked with hog cholera virus and bacilli of the paratyphoid group, with the tetanus bacillus and on the problem of the transmission of encephalitis. He was an important influence in animal pathology in changing the emphasis from comparative pathology to virology.
In 1966 daughter Jane was married (Mrs. Frank Gay) and living in Wilmington, Del.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Member of American Academy of Arts and Sciences, American Society of Immunologists, Society for Experimental Biology and Medicine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists primarily of administrative correspondence with Business Manager while Director of the Department of Animal and Plant Pathology in Princeton.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See RU card catalog for further correspondence with Carl TenBroeck and dealing with the Department of Animal and Plant Pathology.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The papers of Carl TenBroeck were deposited with the Rockefeller University archives by the Business Manager.

eventgrp.event: Assistant, Animal Pathology, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, Princeton
Associate Professor, bacteriology, Peking Union Medical College, Peking, China
Professor and Department Chief in bacteriology, PUMC
Member, Acting Director, Animal Pathology, RIMR, Princeton
Member, Director, Department of Animal and Plant Pathology, RIMR, Princeton
Consultant to U.S. Secretary of War
Died November 4 at Bar Harbor, Maine
Director of a special commission on Dysentery in Hawaii and in the India-Burma Theatre for the Secretary of War, U.S.
Receives The U.S. Medal of Freedom for this service under the Army Epidemiological Board.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographical summary and photocopy of Rockefeller University review, September/October 1966 pp. 20-21.
1942/1944 Descriptive pamphlet summary of Department of Animal and Plant Pathology 1943 Scientific report mimeographed copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily administrative correspondence with Henry James, business manager, but also included early letters on joining the Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research. Some letters while on leave October 1918-May 1919 with the U.S. Army as a Lieutenant. Also includes his resignation in 1920. Many letters are handwritten. The administrative correspondence deals with the establishment of procedures for the new department in Princeton.

did.unittitle: Correspondence from Peking Union Medical College and with his acceptance of offer of appointment as Member of RIMR

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters deal with arrangements for his return, and to bring some experimental mice to the United States. June 1927-June 1928 was spent abroad (Europe) and a letter from Abraham Flexner asks him to make some studies for him of the conditions in Europe for the study of animal pathology. A handwritten note from Edric Smith Nov. 12, 1928 deals with the death of TenBroeck's son.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Deals with appointments, salaries, equipment purchase, personnel and travel to conferences.
16 June 1929 is appointed Acting Director of the Dept. and September 30 as Director for 4 years, making a 5-year appointment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Some handwritten letters and also handwritten copies of Flexner letters from which typed copies are made.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In 1934 Simon Flexner retired and Herbert Gasser became Director of the RIMR laboratories.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: After 1951 Dr. TenBroeck's address is Jackson Memorial Laboratory, Bar Harbor, Maine.
